intro: Charadrophila capensis, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
